questions.text: Which one of the President's two single daughters was engaged to be married?
questions.explanation:
Ellie & Eleanor.

	Ellie was engaged to a fellow scientist named Vic. Abbey and the President found out Ellie and Vic were getting married right away because she was pregnant.

questions.text: Did Ned take the news of his being fired well?
questions.explanation:
No.

	Ned bit Josh's head off after finding out that he was being fired and then told Josh to look in the mirror if he wanted to know why the campaign wasn't going well.

questions.text: What is the name of Toby's lawyer?
questions.explanation:
Alana.

	Toby called Alana while he was in the Roosevelt room to tell her he was the leak and that he was being deposed by White House Counsel.

questions.text: Who did CJ insist be the new Communication Director?
questions.explanation:
Will.

	Three minutes before the President issued a statement about Toby and the leak, CJ went to Will's office and made him the new Communications Director for the White House.

questions.text: Oliver Babish responded to CJ's call when she asked for White House Counsel to come to her office after Toby confessed.
questions.explanation:
False.

	A few minutes after CJ called the White House Counsel's office, Mike Wayne showed up in her office. When she asked about Oliver Babish, Mike said he was at dinner.

questions.text: While Helen was watching a movie on the plane, who did Matt say was in the movie she was watching?
questions.explanation:
Rob Zombie.

	This was a funny scene with Josh, Matt, and Helen. She was watching the movie with earphones on, but vocal during the conversation that Josh and Matt were having about letting some people on staff go.

questions.text: Who was CJ addressing when she made this quote, "Through no fault of your own, your customary default acerbity which some might characterize as snide but which I never fail to find delightful, is perhaps not the right tone for my particular mood this particular evening"?
questions.explanation:
Miles Hutchinson.

	Secretary Hutchinson had just made a snide remark about Kate "entertaining" them about future assassination attempts.

questions.text: What word did Josh tell Lou to use as a description for Vinick?
questions.explanation:
Spry.

	Josh (concerning the word): "It's a word only used to describe old people. Ever hear of anybody under the age of seventy who's ever been called spry?"

questions.text: How did the President refer to both of his vice presidents?
questions.explanation:
Enduring mystery.

	Abbey wanted to know why going to Farad's funeral couldn't be a job for the Vice President.

True.

	Toby tried to resign but the President wouldn't let him because Toby had to be fired. Outside of the Oval Office, Oliver thanked Toby for his service. Toby was then escorted out of the building.
